title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 7100.4 - Meetings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 7100.4 - Meetings

State Regulations

Meetings of the commission may be called by
the chairperson, or a majority of the commissioners, by written or electronic
notice to the other commissioners specifying the time and place of meeting. Such notice will be given at least seven days before the time specified, except
that a meeting may be held on shorter notice, and by telephone notice, if it is
impractical to do otherwise. Notice of meeting may be waived by any
commissioner before or after the meeting, and attendance at a meeting by a
commissioner will constitute a waiver of notice. At least one meeting of the
commission will be held in every calendar year. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
7100.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
